div.p: Mean initial RNA concentrations ( N 0), conditioned on additive genetic variance and random variation due to tank effects, as a function of sex and temperature treatment in the rainbowfish Melanotaenia duboulayi. Females are plotted in white and males in grey. Whiskers denote 95% PDIs; boxes indicate the quartile range of posterior estimates. (A) tmx2b; (B) hmgcs1; (C) nsdhl; (D) pparab; (E) uqcrc2b; (F) agxta; (G) gstr; (H) tefa; (I) ugt2a4; (J) cyp1a; (K) hsp90aa1.2; (L) nr1d4b. Coloured lines denote family‐specific reaction norms for 6 families represented in each temperature treatment. Note that for clarity, only female‐specific reaction norms are presented; plots of random intercept and slopes for both males and females can be found as online supplementary material (Figs S1 and S2).
